definition: to fill a post/to act as
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: This girl acted as our guide.
sentences.chinese: 這女孩子充任我們的嚮導。

sentences.english: A new kind of computer can act as a guide to a blind person.
sentences.chinese: 一種新型計算機能夠充任盲人的嚮導。

sentences.english: Sentence center is predicate, topic sentences yuan in nominal element ACTS as, by.
sentences.chinese: 句子中心是謂詞，題元在句子中由名詞性成分充任。

sentences.english: In times of war peasants are forced from their farms and drafted into levies. Good cannon fodder.
sentences.chinese: 農民經常在戰時被強行徵召入伍，充任廉價炮灰。

sentences.english: Dr. Pelt had had ample of experience playing presidential bartender.
sentences.chinese: 佩爾特博士充任總統的酒吧侍者已是老手了。

definition: to serve as/to be a substitute for
to supervise (troops)/to appoint (officers)/to select and assign
to appoint
consultant/adviser
title (position within an organization)
to work solely on/to have as one's (or its) sole function/person or agency responsible for one specific thing
ordained or appointed to a post/to benefit from counsel
to govern/to have complete control over/to be in command of
to conscript
to appoint
an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
variant of 參與|参与[can1 yu4]
military official/military attaché
key job/important position
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
appointment (to a job)/to be appointed (to high office)/to accept an appointment/entrusted with responsibilities/same as 授任
